japanese_title: 兎が自ら歌った謡「サンパヤ テレケ」
japanese_translation:
(1) アマツポ(弩いしゆみ)すなわち「仕掛け弓」を仕掛ける事.
(2) 刀剣.これは戦争の時に使う刀剣とは違うので,ふだん家の右座の宝物の積んである上に吊してあるのがそれです.戦争の時には使いませんが,uniwente などのときには使います.
chinese_translation:
(1) アマツポ(弩いしゆみ),即「機關弓」的設置。
(2) 刀劍。此與戰爭時使用的刀劍不同,平時是吊在家中右座堆放寶物之處。戰爭時不會使用,但在 uniwente 等場合會使用。
english_translation:
(1) Amatsupo (弩いしゆみ): That is, setting up a "trick bow."
(2) Swords. These are different from the swords used in war. They are usually hung above the pile of treasures on the right side of the house. They are not used in war, but are used during *uniwente*, etc.
updated_chinese_translation:
(1)アマツポ(弩いしゆみ)，即是設置「詭計弓」。
(2)刀劍。這與戰爭時使用的刀劍不同，平時懸掛在家中右側堆放寶物之處。戰爭時不會使用，但在 *uniwente* 等場合會使用。
update_comment: The English translation is generally accurate but could be improved by incorporating the conciseness and clarity of the Chinese translation, especially regarding the description of the swords' placement. The Chinese translation uses "詭計弓" which is more descriptive than "trick bow". The Chinese translation also more concisely describes where the swords are hung. The phrase "right side of the house where treasures are piled" is more direct than "above the pile of treasures on the right side of the house."
updated_english_translation:
(1) Amatsupo (弩いしゆみ): That is, setting up a "contrivance bow."
(2) Swords. These are different from swords used in war and are usually hung on the right side of the house where treasures are piled. They are not used in war but are used during *uniwente*, etc.
